alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 8:43PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, the Mendenhall Valley and Auke Lake in the Central Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 839 PM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding of small streams, especially near Mendenhall Lake and River, Montana Creek, Jordan Creek and Auke Lake. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen. Rainfall rates of 0.1-0.3 inches in 1 hour are expected. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible. - For Auke Lake near Auke Bay: At 8:00pm the stage was 32.44 feet. Flood Stage is 33.0 feet. Impacts: At 33.0 feet: Water from the lake will inundate yards of homes along Auke Lake. For Jordan Creek near Juneau: At 8:00pm the stage was 9.41 feet. Flood Stage is 9.7 feet. Forecast: A crest around 10.47 feet is expected around 10:00am Saturday. Impacts: At 9.2 feet: This is the stage when Jordan Creek is at bankfull and water will begin to inundate areas along the edges of the creek near Race Reality and Jordan Square. At 9.7 feet: Water will inundate the Jordan Square`s front and back parking lots, around Jordan Creek office condominiums with up to one foot of water. Some residential driveways will be flooded and cut off. At 10.5 feet: There will be some inundation of structures and roads near Jordan Creek with more than one foot of water. Some residential homes and commercial offices along the creek will see significant flooding. For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 8:00pm the stage was 14.12 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 15.51 feet is expected around 4:00am Saturday. Impacts: At 15.0 feet: At this stage the river is bankfull at the gage and water starts to inundate adjacent undeveloped fields. Water begins flowing over the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road. At 15.5 feet: Flood stage - 3-6 inches of water at low water crossing on Montana Creek Road For Mendenhall Lake : At 8:15pm the stage was 7.57 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 8.9 feet is expected around 10:00am Saturday. Impacts: At 6.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the "causeway" at the end of the trail. At 7.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the beginning of the trail. Along the Mendenhall River some sections will experience bank erosion resulting in dangerous tree fall. These conditions could make floating the river more hazardous with the higher water levels. At 9.0 feet: Water covers Skaters Cabin Road between Skaters Cabin and West Glacier Trailhead, also water will flow into the Mendenhall Lake Campground. - If you live along Mendenhall Lake and River, Montana Creek, Jordan Creek, or Auke Lake stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
